Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.add_process_time_header(request: Request, call_next)¶
main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
main.read_root()¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Cats¶

async src.repository.cats.create_cat(body: PetModel, db: Session)¶

The create_cat function creates a new cat in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – PetModel: Define the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The cat that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.cats.get_cat(cat_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_cat function returns a cat object from the database.

Parameters:

  • cat_id – int: Specify the id of the cat we want to get

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The cat with the given id

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.cats.get_cats(limit: int, offset: int, owner_id: int, is_vaccinated: bool, db: Session)¶

The get_cats function returns a list of cats.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set

  • owner_id – int: Filter the cats by owner_id

  • is_vaccinated – bool: Filter the cats by whether they are vaccinated or not

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of cats

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.cats.remove_cat(cat_id: int, db: Session)¶
The remove_cat function removes a cat from the database.
Args:

cat_id (int): The id of the cat to remove. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • cat_id – int: Specify the id of the cat to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A cat object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.cats.update_cat(body: PetModel, cat_id: int, db: Session)¶
The update_cat function updates a cat in the database.
Args:

body (PetModel): The PetModel object containing the new data for the cat. cat_id (int): The id of the Cat to update. db (Session): A Session instance used to query and commit changes to our database.

Parameters:

  • body – PetModel: Get the data from the request body

  • cat_id – int: Specify which cat to update

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated cat object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.cats.update_vaccinated_cat(body: PetStatusVaccinated, cat_id: int, db: Session)¶

The update_vaccinated_cat function updates the vaccinated status of a cat in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – PetStatusVaccinated: Pass the pet status vaccinated object to the function

  • cat_id – int: Identify the cat that is being updated

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The cat object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Cats¶

async src.routes.cats.create_cat(body: PetModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.cats.get_cat(cat_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_cat function is a GET endpoint that returns the cat with the given id. If no such cat exists, it raises an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • cat_id – int: Specify the type of data that is expected in the path parameter

  • ge – Specify that the value must be greater than or equal to 1

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A cat object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.cats.get_cats(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, owner_id: int | None = None, is_vaccinated: bool | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_cats function returns a list of cats.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • le – Limit the maximum value of a parameter

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning

  • owner_id – int: Filter the cats by owner_id

  • is_vaccinated – bool: Filter the cats by whether they are vaccinated or not

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of cats

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.cats.remove_cat(cat_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.cats.update_cat(body: PetStatusVaccinated, cat_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
